intro: Serapias helleborine var. latifolia, commonly known as the broad-leaved serapias, is a perennial herbaceous plant native to southern Europe. It belongs to the family Ranunculaceae and is characterized by its rhizomatous growth habit. The plant produces showy, yellow-orange flowers with five petals and numerous stamens, typically blooming in late spring to early summer. Its leaves are broad and palmately lobed, often with a hairy surface. It thrives in woodland or grassland habitats and is often found in shaded, moist environments.
